note.p: Birth: Stoke, near Plymouth, Devon, England (22 September 1800)

Career: Lived in France (1814-1827) and in Russia; spoke five languages; Honorary Secretary, Horticultural Society (1829-1840); published 'Memoirs of genera and natural orders of Indian Plants' (1832-1836) and 'Handbook of British Flora' (1858); worked at Kew (after 1861)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1884-1885 vol 38 pp i-v signed by D O
